# Week 11

# 10/29 - The Classical Era

Today we'll introduce the late-eighteenth-century style of Mozart and Haydn. There are lots of ways to approach this style. Today we're going to focus on how Mozart and Haydn "dramatize" the harmonic language they inherited from Corelli, Vivaldi, and Bach.

Reminder: Start bringing Part 2 of the Course Packet!

  • Bach and Mozart
  • Dramatizing Tonality: A Mozart opera scene
    • "Susana, or via sortite" from The Marriage of Figaro

Presentation

# 10/30 - Drill

Today we'll look at an early keyboard sonata by Haydn. Don't forget to bring part two of your course packet.

# 10/31 - Phrase Types

Reminder: No class Thursday or Friday, but HW 8 is due on Monday.

Today we'll review the basic phrase types and take a preliminary look at one of the big pieces on the listening list: Mozart's Great G minor Symphony.

  • HW 8: Haydn, Quartet in GM, Op. 71, no. 1
  • Phrase Types: Sentence and Period
  • Mozart, Symphony no. 40 in Gm, K.550

Presentation

And then we'll see you on Monday.
